Generation V.Black: Since a broken tusk will not grow back, they diligently sharpen their tusks on river rocks after they've been fighting.
Generation V.White: Their tusks can shatter rocks. Territory battles between Fraxure can be intensely violent.
Generation V.Black 2: A broken tusk will not grow back, so it diligently sharpens its tusks on river rocks after the end of a battle.
Generation V.White 2: A broken tusk will not grow back, so it diligently sharpens its tusks on river rocks after the end of a battle.

Generation VI.X: Their tusks can shatter rocks. Territory battles between Fraxure can be intensely violent.
Generation VI.Y: A broken tusk will not grow back, so it diligently sharpens its tusks on river rocks after the end of a battle.
Generation VI.Omega Ruby: Their tusks can shatter rocks. Territory battles between Fraxure can be intensely violent.
Generation VI.Alpha Sapphire: A broken tusk will not grow back, so it diligently sharpens its tusks on river rocks after the end of a battle.

Generation VIII.Sword: After battle, this Pokémon carefully sharpens its tusks on river rocks. It needs to take care of its tusks—if one breaks, it will never grow back.
Generation VIII.Shield: Its skin is as hard as a suit of armor. Fraxure's favorite strategy is to tackle its opponents, stabbing them with its tusks at the same time.

Generation IX.Scarlet: Because its tusks don’t grow back once they break, this Pokémon apparently won’t use them unless truly necessary.
Generation IX.Violet: Fraxure uses its thick tusks to neatly cut prey into two portions—one to eat now and one to save for later.

Generation VIII.Sword: Rolling Fields , Axew's Eye Sw ( Max Raid Battle )
Generation VIII.Shield: Rolling Fields , Axew's Eye Sw ( Max Raid Battle )
